details.description: Mental illness is a growing concern in the UK. It affects one in four people and costs the economy about £70bn each year. It is also the cause of 40% of new disability benefit claims each year.
details.content:
Beyond being a repository for information and data, there is scope for Plexus to play a daily or hourly part in a user's life. M/A is exploring how Plexus can link people with mental health conditions with employers in a two-way relationship, keeping their support relevant and helpful in the route back to work and to better mental health.

User testing will need to be carried out and spread across the country to get broad feedback, which will be used to:

  • refine content
  • add achievement badges and devise the methods in which they are gained, awarded to users and grow with interaction types
  • help create long-term relationships between pods of users across the country
  • help employers gain insight and greater understanding of the issues being faced by users

M/A has also applied to the accelerator programme Bethnal Green Ventures in the hope of having the opportunity to continue the development and evolution of Plexus as part of its Winter/Spring 15/16 cohort.

M/A is also developing an interactive tool, ‘Social Investment Matrix’, which maps the UK social investment market for the Cabinet Office, due for public release in November. M/A will also showcase the Plexus prototype and outline development plans to Cabinet Office for their insight, feedback and support.

With Mind data being a core offering of the app, M/A will strive to create a partnership with Mind around the tool to explore how it could have a positive effect on their communities and how it could be applied or adapted most usefully for their users.

M/A will also be releasing more of Mind’s datasets to the open data community and will further integrate the concept of data release within the organisation.

M/A will create sets of user testers to gain first-hand insight and feedback around Plexus to move it forwards. It will also create a rewards space so that users can see where they are successful and get feedback and support on their continued use of Plexus. Finally, M/A plans to use data specially chosen from the Department for Work and Pensions and combine it with data from Plexus users.

We expect this to give our users an improved understanding of how the issue(s) they face on a daily basis are challenged and coped with by people the length and breadth of the country.

– Martin Vowles, Director of M/A

Do you think Plexus could be a useful tool for you or your organisation? Would you like to be a Plexus user tester or do you have ideas on how it could be developed? Contact the team at studio@ma-work.co.uk.
